data.title: array comprehension
data.body:
would be nice to be able to create arrays using pythonish comprehension like
`array = [[0 for y in range(10)] for x in range(10)]`
or even with conditionals like
`array = [i for i in range(10) if i % 2]`
it also enables to simulate 'map' function like
`result_array = [item.count - 1 for item in other_array if item.type == 'bullet']`

data.title: array slicing
data.body:
would be nice if we can use pythonish slice feature like

```
array[2:4]
array[2:]
array[:-1]
```

or even may be extended slicing with step

```
array[::2]
array[::-1]
```

data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

It works with  Godot 2.0.2 / Godot_v2.0.2_stable_export_templates.tpz

data.title: Entire engine Crashes When clicking on empty space in the editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**

Using Manjaro Arch, with the godot-git package from the AUR, installed via yaourt

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

The engine closes entirely when clicking on empty space.

**Steps to reproduce:**

Simply clicking on anything that isn't an object in the scene or a UI element will cause a crash.
Sadly no error messages are coming up when ran through a terminal. Is there any log files I can check to see what's wrong?

data.title: Scripts improvement. Discussion
data.body:
Furious that the script file is a class. On the one hand it is convenient in terms of resources. Always clear what script to load. But on the other hand it is very inconvenient in terms of development. Often what is needed auxiliary functions or objects you want to access from many places. And to use such objects in the current approach is very inconvenient. Of course one might say that there are cars loaded scripts. You can use them. But they are made as a node. And get them out of difficult subclasses. It is necessary to transmit the node. Either create a helper class instance. There's a lot that can be said. But what do you think about the fact that to do in Unity, hang on the node class rather than the entire file?
PS. Offline for some strange reason I can not create threads. Writes are not correct insert verification letters :(

data.title: Scene menu "Close Goto Prev. Scene" option does not work
data.body: ... and should likely be dropped, it's a leftover from the days where Godot could only load one scene at a time.

data.title: Check the save path before importing a 3D Mesh
data.body:
This is particularly useful for big meshes.
Fixes #1119

data.title: Ignore alpha materials in baked light ray-tracer.
data.body: I made this PR a while back but there was a syntax error on certain GCC compiler setups, and I ended up forgetting about it. Either way, the issue should be resolved now, and this small update simply allows the light baker rays to ignore transluscent surfaces like windows, ect.

data.title: Directory.dir_exists() always fails on res:// type paths even though Directory.open() works
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10, Godot 2.1 alpha custom build

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):

```
directory = Directory.new()
if not directory.dir_exists("res://path/to/dir"):
   print ("Directory does not exist")
if directory.open("res://path/to/dir) == OK:
  print("Directory open works")
```

Output:
  Directory does not exist
  Directory open works

Expected:
  Directory open works

**Steps to reproduce:**

```
directory.dir_exists(directory.get_current_dir())
```

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Code editor auto complete feature must use scene hierarchy info to prevent cliping paths too early
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Using : Godot_v2.0.2_stable_x11.64 on linuxmint 17.2

auto complete list in code editor is cliping node paths depenging on the last letter written as illustrated below.

```
get_node("CenterContainer/VBoxContainer/Panel/Button$
         |CenterContainer/VBoxContainer/Panel/Button|
         |CenterContainer/VBoxContainer/Panel/Button|
         |CenterContainer/VBoxContainer/Panel/Button|
         |CenterContainer/VBoxContainer/Panel/Button|
         |CenterContainer/VBoxContainer/Panel/Button|
         |CenterContainer/VBoxContainer/Panel/Button|
```

It would be better to use biggest next word while listing nodes as below.

```
get_node("CenterContainer/VBoxContainer/Panel/Button$
         |CenterContainer/VBoxContainer/Panel/Button_Up   |
         |CenterContainer/VBoxContainer/Panel/Button_Down |
         |CenterContainer/VBoxContainer/Panel/Button_Aim  |
         |CenterContainer/VBoxContainer/Panel/ButtonGroup/|
         |CenterContainer/VBoxContainer/Panel/ButtonGroup/|
         |CenterContainer/VBoxContainer/Panel/ButtonL/Zone|
```

**Steps to reproduce:**
Take a SamplePlayer2D for example, create a new SampleLibrary, import sounds and try to play a sound in the SampleLibrary panel.

data.title: fix compile failure when tools=no
Screen being drawn in the middle of handling an event
data.body:
Windows 10 - Godot 2.0.3

(This issue seems to be specific to Windows operating systems. It did not show up on iOS or on Android.)

**Situation**

I have a project with 3 nodes:
1. Sprite
2. Node2D
3. Area2D (with a child shape, etc.)

Both Node2D and Area2D have a script that moves the Sprite to a different position when the mouse is clicked. Node2D does this with _input(ev) and Area2D does this with _input_event(...).

**What I expected**

If I click somewhere not on Area2D's shape, the Sprite will move directly to the position specified by Node2D. If I click on Area2D's shape, the Sprite will move directly to the position specified by Area2D. This is because events are handled by _input(ev) before _input_event(...). So the Sprite would first go Node2D's specified position, and then go to Area2D's specified position, and then finally be drawn to the screen.

**What happened**

When I click on Area2D's shape, sometimes the Sprite is drawn at Node2D's specified position for a few frames, and then moves to Area2D's specified position. This seems like an error because the mouse click event is clearly being handled by Node2D, then a screen draw occurs before the event is handled by Area2D. I thought that an event should propagate through all nodes before a screen draw happens.

**Steps to reproduce:**

In a project, add 2 nodes, one of them a CollisionObject2D. Give one an _input(ev) function and the other an _input_event(...) function. Have them both alter a sprite in a similar way, like changing its location. To really see the issue clearly, add a time-intensive loop right before the CollisionObject2D node modifies the sprite, such as an unnecessary nested for loop.

Example project demonstrating this issue: [Godot Demo.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/270561/Godot.Demo.zip)

data.title: Improve the user:// path
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:** all

**Issue description**: Two things
1 - the user path where files are saved should be the same as all other apps in that OS. for Linux, this is usually ~/.local/share/whatever. Right now it's in ~/.godot/whatever
2 - it would be nice to remove the 'godot' folder, and just use the app name. For exported builds, it doesnt look nice

not sure how it is on the mac as I can not test

data.title: Windows Only - Background Throttling on Dragged Window
data.body:
https://www.reddit.com/r/godot/comments/4jpjdh/question_disable_game_throttling_on_window_drag/

When dragging the window, the game freezes (locks thread) before letting go.  Doesn't happen on Linux though (see video in thread).

Looks like this is only happening on **Windows** builds

Not sure if this is reported, I have searched github so my apologizes if it's already reported. 

:+1:

data.title: Adds invert() method DVector
data.body:
Satisfies issue #4601 
Cleaned up this PR.

This effectively allows invert() to be used on the following types:
ByteArray, IntArray, RealArray, StringArray, Vector2Array, Vector3Array, ColorArray

The last issues to be brought up were:
-Assigning the size values to variables (see s and half_s)
-Operating on a Write() pointer instead of using get() and set()
These have been satisfied.

data.title: Fix some crashes on DVector (GCC 6) especially in DVector<String>
data.body:
Please review it carefully (I hope I didn't miss anything) and test on GCC 6. It fixes the crash on my PC (GCC 6.1.1, Arch Linux, x64). Tested also on AVX (`-mavx`):

``` assembly
vmovdqa YMMWORD PTR [rcx],ymm0
```

and it works properly, too (especially under tests... :D) :)

What about `Vector`? It actually doesn't crash there, but it also doesn't have aligned data...

data.title: Wireframe View in editor does not clear
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7 64 bit - Godot 2.0.3 64 bit and 32 bit

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I switched the editor to the wireframe mode (3D -> View -> Display Wireframe) and i moved the camera around, but the editor didn't clear the view properly and this happens: 
![godot_wireframe_view_noclear](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9016634/15325490/d97af6fc-1c4a-11e6-81bd-f71f3455d276.PNG)

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Open project
2. Switch to wireframe rendering mode
3. Move the camera around
4. TADA you see it

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Every example project thats 3D should work
